com.projetloki.genesis

Interface CssBuilder


  • public interface CssBuilder
    Object passed to a CSS module, that receives rules and other declarations. See CssModule for examples.
    Author:
    Cl√©ment Roux

    • Method Detail

      • addRule

        void addRule(Selector selector,
           PropertiesOrBuilder properties)
        Adds a CSS rule to this builder.

      • addRule

        void addRule(String selector,
           PropertiesOrBuilder properties)
        Adds a CSS rule to this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given string is not the CSS notation of a selector

      • addRule

        void addRule(Selector selector,
           PropertiesOrBuilder properties,
           MediaCondition condition)
        Adds a conditional CSS rule to this builder. The rule only applies if the condition is satisfied. The CSS notation of a conditional rule is 
         @media condition {
   selector {
     properties
   }
 }

      • addRule

        void addRule(String selector,
           PropertiesOrBuilder properties,
           MediaCondition condition)
        Adds a conditional CSS rule to this builder. The rule only applies if the condition is satisfied. The CSS notation of a conditional rule is 
         @media condition {
   selector {
     properties
   }
 }
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given string is not the CSS notation of a selector

      • addRules

        void addRules(String rules)
        Reads CSS rules from the given string, and adds them to this builder. Example: 
         out.addRules(
     ".balloon{width:20px;height:20px}" +
     ".balloon-box{background:blue}");

        The input string can't contain @-rules ( @import, @keyface, etc.). CSS comments are allowed, but they will be discarded.

        This method can be used to import a whole CSS file from Java resources. Example: 

         String css = com.google.common.io.Resources.toString(
     getClass().getResource("my-css.css"), Charsets.UTF_8);
 out.addRules(css);

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given string is not a valid sequence of CSS rules

      • addRules

        void addRules(String rules,
            MediaCondition condition)
        Same as addRules(String), but adds conditional rules.

      • install

        void install(CssModule module)
        Installs the given module if it has not been installed yet.

        All the modules that are installed in the CssModule.configure(CssBuilder) method of M are called the dependencies of M.

        Throws:
        CssModuleException - if an exception happens during the execution of CssModule.configure(CssBuilder)

      • use

        void use(FontFace fontFace)
        Declares the given font-face rule. Its definition will be added on top of the CSS file.

      • use

        void use(Keyframes keyframes)
        Declares the given keyframes rule. Its definition will be added on top of the CSS file.

      • importCss

        void importCss(String uri)
        Adds an import rule to this builder. Tells browsers to import the CSS at the given URI.

        You should rarely have to use imports. It's better to have a single CSS, generated by possibly several modules.

        See Also:
        MDN

      • importCss

        void importCss(String uri,
             MediaCondition condition)
        Adds a conditional import rule to this builder. Tells browsers to import the CSS at the given URI if the given condition is satisfied.

        You should rarely have to use imports. It's better to have a single CSS, generated by possibly several modules.

        See Also:
        MDN
